_meta.artifact_name: Concept Memo - Scaling Air Quality & Mold Risk Policy Beyond Military Pilot
_meta.policy_context: Scaling Air Quality & Mold Risk Policy Beyond Military Pilot

executive_summary.policy_opportunity: Policy opportunity detected in renewable energy sector based on industry signals, regulatory gaps, and agency rulemaking announcements.

industry_opportunities: Property management associations reporting increased tenant complaints about air quality and mold issues in residential buildings. Demand for standardized monitoring and remediation protocols.
Health insurers identifying respiratory illness claims linked to poor indoor air quality. Interest in preventive policy measures to reduce long-term healthcare costs.
Veterans organizations advocating for extension of military facility air quality standards to veteran housing programs (VA housing, Section 8 vouchers).
School districts reporting inconsistent state/local air quality standards for educational facilities. Gap between military facility standards and civilian school requirements.
regulatory_context: EPA announced upcoming rulemaking process for indoor air quality standards in public buildings. Opportunity to align with military pilot findings.
HUD expressing interest in evidence-based air quality standards for public housing. Military pilot data could inform HUD rulemaking.
CDC updating health guidance on mold exposure and respiratory health. Opportunity to link military pilot health outcomes to broader public health policy.
legal_precedents: Recent court rulings on landlord liability for mold-related health issues creating precedent for federal air quality standards in residential housing.
State court decisions showing inconsistent application of air quality standards across jurisdictions. Federal standardization opportunity identified.

military_pilot_context.pilot_scope: Military facility air quality and mold risk monitoring and remediation protocols

military_pilot_context.verification_method: NDAA legislative language provides independent verification of military pilot program
military_pilot_context.verification_note: Evidence verified in NDAA - stop condition satisfied. Policy scaling can proceed.
military_pilot_context.scaling_rationale: Military pilot success documented in NDAA provides evidence base for scaling to civilian contexts. Natural transition pathways exist through veterans organizations and public housing programs.
